text: <@U088WG9UYK1> / <@U0821PFKM0V>, Hi everyone, just checking in on the status of mainnet onboarding slots. We’ve been running the DevNet validator for a while now and are getting comfortable with the setup. I understand this week’s major upgrade is likely keeping things busy, but I wanted to follow up on where things stand for Blueprint’s mainnet onboarding.

elements.text: , Hi everyone, just checking in on the status of mainnet onboarding slots. We’ve been running the DevNet validator for a while now and are getting comfortable with the setup. I understand this week’s major upgrade is likely keeping things busy, but I wanted to follow up on where things stand for Blueprint’s mainnet onboarding.

Hi, I am setting up the helm charts using ArgoCD, but some charts use `{{ .Release.name }}`  to fill name and selectors, creates a conflict between resources that also use the release name. Could you add a way to overwrite, using a variable, for example?

elements.text: Hi, I am setting up the helm charts using ArgoCD, but some charts use
{{ .Release.name }}
to fill name and selectors, creates a conflict between resources that also use the release name. Could you add a way to overwrite, using a variable, for example?

text: Our infrastructure uses App of Apps, which in our case is Canton, and to deploy the helm charts we use dependency.

elements.text: Our infrastructure uses App of Apps, which in our case is Canton, and to deploy the helm charts we use dependency.

text: And when dependencies are used they get the parent Chart name

elements.text: And when dependencies are used they get the parent Chart name

text: Participant and Postgres chart uses `app: {{ .Release.name }}`

elements.text: Participant and Postgres chart uses
app: {{ .Release.name }}

text:
that’s how my kustomization file looks like:

```---
apiVersion: <http://kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1beta1|kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1beta1>
kind: Kustomization
namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
helmCharts:
  - name: splice-postgres
    repo: <oci://ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/helm>
    version: 0.3.21
    releaseName: postgres
    namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    valuesFile: postgres-values-validator-participant.yaml
  - name: splice-participant
    repo: <oci://ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/helm>
    version: 0.3.21
    releaseName: participant
    namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    valuesFile: participant-values.yaml
    additionalValuesFiles: [standalone-participant-values.yaml]
  - name: splice-validator
    repo: <oci://ghcr.io/digital-asset/decentralized-canton-sync/helm>
    version: 0.3.21
    releaseName: validator
    namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    valuesFile: validator-values.yaml
    additionalValuesFiles: [standalone-validator-values.yaml]

resources:
  - infisical-secret.yaml
  - ingress.yaml
  - kong-cors-plugin.yaml

patches:
  - target:
      kind: Deployment
      namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    patch: |-
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/static-egress-ip
        value: "true"
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/egress-gateway
        value: "2"
  - target:
      kind: StatefulSet
      namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    patch: |-
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/static-egress-ip
        value: "true"
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/egress-gateway
        value: "2"```

elements.text: that’s how my kustomization file looks like:

---
apiVersion: kustomize.config.k8s.io/v1beta1
kind: Kustomization
namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
helmCharts:
  - name: splice-postgres
    repo:

version: 0.3.21
    releaseName: postgres
    namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    valuesFile: postgres-values-validator-participant.yaml
  - name: splice-participant
    repo:

version: 0.3.21
    releaseName: participant
    namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    valuesFile: participant-values.yaml
    additionalValuesFiles: [standalone-participant-values.yaml]
  - name: splice-validator
    repo:

version: 0.3.21
    releaseName: validator
    namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    valuesFile: validator-values.yaml
    additionalValuesFiles: [standalone-validator-values.yaml]

resources:
  - infisical-secret.yaml
  - ingress.yaml
  - kong-cors-plugin.yaml

patches:
  - target:
      kind: Deployment
      namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    patch: |-
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/static-egress-ip
        value: "true"
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/egress-gateway
        value: "2"
  - target:
      kind: StatefulSet
      namespace: angkor-canton-mainnet
    patch: |-
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/static-egress-ip
        value: "true"
      - op: add
        path: /spec/template/metadata/labels/egress-gateway
        value: "2"

text:
Hi,

I have a dev validator on devnet, it's working normally. As in, it mints reward. asset can be transfer in/out. I can create new party, using it fine.

But there is a single party, that party cannot transfer fund out/in. In the ledger log, I can see the error for that particular party

```{"@timestamp":"2025-06-24T15:29:00.407Z","@version":"1","message":"Restarting ledger ingestion loop after 30 seconds due to unexpected exception:","logger_name":"o.l.s.a.UpdateIngestionService:validator=validator_backend/endUserParty=9::12207e20949d/ingestionLoopFor=DbUserWalletStore","thread_name":"canton-env-ec-22","level":"INFO","level_value":20000,"stack_trace":"org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "user_wallet_txlog_store_si_ti_ei_key"
  Detail: Key (store_id, tx_log_id, event_id)=(2737, txh, #12204623d088c08232085092ab2c33320933a81df104ea543cf8b8693dd7349e5edd:0) already exists.
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2725)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2412)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:371)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeInternal(PgStatement.java:502)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.execute(PgStatement.java:419)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeWithFlags(PgPreparedStatement.java:194)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.execute(PgPreparedStatement.java:180)
	at com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.ProxyPreparedStatement.execute(ProxyPreparedStatement.java:44)
	at com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.HikariProxyPreparedStatement.execute(HikariProxyPreparedStatement.java)
	at slick.jdbc.StatementInvoker.results(StatementInvoker.scala:44)
	at slick.jdbc.StatementInvoker.iteratorTo(StatementInvoker.scala:26)
	at slick.jdbc.Invoker.first(Invoker.scala:32)
	at slick.jdbc.Invoker.first$(Invoker.scala:31)
	at slick.jdbc.StatementInvoker.first(StatementInvoker.scala:19)
	at slick.jdbc.StreamingInvokerAction$HeadAction.run(StreamingInvokerAction.scala:56)
	at slick.jdbc.StreamingInvokerAction$HeadAction.run(StreamingInvokerAction.scala:53)
	at slick.dbio.DBIOAction$$anon$4.$anonfun$run$3(DBIOAction.scala:259)
	at scala.collection.immutable.Vector.foreach(Vector.scala:2125)
	at slick.dbio.DBIOAction$$anon$4.run(DBIOAction.scala:259)
	at slick.dbio.DBIOAction$$anon$4.run(DBIOAction.scala:257)
	at slick.dbio.DBIOAction$$anon$4.$anonfun$run$3(DBIOAction.scala:259)
	at scala.collection.immutable.Vector.foreach(Vector.scala:2125)
	at slick.dbio.DBIOAction$$anon$4.run(DBIOAction.scala:259)
	at slick.dbio.DBIOAction$$anon$4.run(DBIOAction.scala:257)
	at slick.basic.BasicBackend$BasicDatabaseDef.liftedTree1$1(BasicBackend.scala:323)
	at slick.basic.BasicBackend$BasicDatabaseDef.$anonfun$runSynchronousDatabaseAction$2(BasicBackend.scala:323)
	at slick.basic.BasicBackend$BasicDatabaseDef.$anonfun$runSynchronousDatabaseAction$2$adapted(BasicBackend.scala:318)
	at slick.util.AsyncExecutor$PrioritizedRunnable$$anon$6.run(AsyncExecutor.scala:330)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1136)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:635)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:840)
","span-id":"efc6c9ba5c650835","trace-id":"6b6ba921fc2573e073dae75faa597bcf","span-name":"ledger ingestion loop"```
I don't really know how we entered this state. By the time I checked, I belived there are many related wallet related api we call around before that. So I'm not sure if any of these API cause it. We were learning stuff with the API.

Is there anyway to fix this state? as in, is it ok to manually clean out the database row for this party? Or maybe off-board them completely and just forgot about it?

And how to debug the root cause of this? I think I can try to narrow down the first time this happen and trace back to see what is it before? But wonder if there is any better lead/approach to understand and fix this?

text: <https://bron.org/>

Thank you <@U02SR6E8Z9S>! Yes, we have this config applied. In the process of deploying PQS, it was configured with multiple app identities, which resulted in collisions in PostgreSQL on transaction id. Wiping DB and getting PQS running with a stable app identity was the key here.

elements.text: Thank you

! Yes, we have this config applied. In the process of deploying PQS, it was configured with multiple app identities, which resulted in collisions in PostgreSQL on transaction id. Wiping DB and getting PQS running with a stable app identity was the key here.

text: To clarify: tx id collision in PQS resulted in PQS requesting a fresh token every minute

elements.text: To clarify: tx id collision in PQS resulted in PQS requesting a fresh token every minute

text: Just reading some migration docs, is there a point in the process where validators have to upgrade their Daml std lib versions?

elements.text: Just reading some migration docs, is there a point in the process where validators have to upgrade their Daml std lib versions?

text: If you're deploying via Docker or k8s, the updated images for the validator and participant will include the appropriate version of the Daml libraries.

elements.text: If you're deploying via Docker or k8s, the updated images for the validator and participant will include the appropriate version of the Daml libraries.

text: Ah thanks so when you upgrade your validator/participant node it already has the latest version.

elements.text: Ah thanks so when you upgrade your validator/participant node it already has the latest version.

text:
ok, as a follow up then… how can I tell which version’s been installed? The doc here <https://docs.test.sync.global/app_dev/overview/version_information.html> , is a bit confusing.

If I want my dars to compile and work, I need to use the middle version? Is the top version what is installed on the node and because it is older it can support earlier versions?

text:
Hello <@UEHLS0JUB> glad that you once again have ample time to clear up my confusion. Ok, maybe I am on the wrong track. After uploading a dar to our node (afaiu with vetting set to true), when trying to create an instance of a template we get this message in the logs.
```{"@timestamp":"2025-06-19T15:02:33.233Z","@version":"1","message":"Phase 1: Pass 1 of topology-aware package selection command processing failed synchronizer routing: RoutingFailed(Error(Map(global-domain::1220e1e594cd... -> Some packages are not known to all informees on synchronizer global-domain::1220e1e594cd...\nParticipant PAR::validator-c7-2-testnet::12203c25336f... has not vetted 9d1a644e6864...)))","logger_name":"c.d.c.p.a.e.TopologyAwareCommandExecutor:participant=participant","thread_name":"canton-env-ec-36667","level":"DEBUG","level_value":10000,"trace-id":"749181e597660bd871ccae43a0e88e96"}```
Now, `9d1a...`is not my package id:
```$ daml damlc inspect-dar dars/domain-verification-model-0.0.4.dar --json | jq -r .main_package_id
5e2d1f074d5c5f108efe211c776951788ff42f87f3dd78cc6327e2be4e8ea88d```
but it is
```$ daml damlc inspect-dar dars/domain-verification-model-0.0.4.dar | grep 9d1a
domain-verification-model-0.0.4-5e2d1f074d5c5f108efe211c776951788ff42f87f3dd78cc6327e2be4e8ea88d/daml-stdlib-3.3.0.20250502.13767.0-9d1a644e686435cf934f2f3f049138a424863b2a800130046dadc0c994ea5df3.dalf```

text:
Hi,

I have a validator on mainnet `TransferAgent-mainnet-1::12204a039322c01e9f714b56259c3e68b69058bf5dfe1debbe956c698f905ceba9d7`, it's working, log look good, reward is minted, metrics is fine etc.

But when I try to transfer CC to `Fairmint-validator-1::122047f456985651be8ea317881a9af4f04521417ce1a449b75543541acf33aac4d2`

I got this error on browser console

```<https://wallet.validator.transfer-agent.xyz/api/validator/v0/wallet/transfer-preapproval/send>

{
  "error" : "CONTRACT_NOT_FOUND(11,c2ace042): Contract could not be found with id 007012058698d54cc0658fe6f03dca02ff1fcbed22de303afb3b0b05ae64ab7d00ca10122035cf8baf98deb44492128beab1d68d7801edb7dee9bf74f28d9edce9a13a5af0"
}```
Both of the sender and receiver had pre-approve incoming direct transfer of canton coin.

On the log I can see similar error. Will share log on thread

Note: the error only occurs when sending out CC to this paricular party id.

```Fairmint-validator-1::122047f456985651be8ea317881a9af4f04521417ce1a449b75543541acf33aac4d2 ```
But incoming CC transfer from that party works.

text:
Hi Oriol,

Thank you for your help.

It's interesting that the row is actually _not in db_. So the error probably occurs in a transaction so it's rollback all together.

<https://gist.github.com/v9n/60e118314497f9571e9ea78f67791fa3>

On our participant, this log repeated over and over

text: Thank you for your help as always Moritz. Here is wider log for validator.

elements.text: Thank you for your help as always Moritz. Here is wider log for validator.
It still returns no result

select *
from user_wallet_txlog_store as txl
         join store_descriptors sd on txl.store_id = sd.id
where txl.store_id = 2737 and txl.event_id = '#12204623d088c08232085092ab2c33320933a81df104ea543cf8b8693dd7349e5edd:0';
(0 rows)
In fact, if only perform the below queries, there are 3 rows,and none of them are
